decks.notes: The deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand while utilizing efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats on the board. It aims to apply pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Raging Ravine, backed up by card advantage engines like Dark Confidant and Courser of Kruphix. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Pyromaster to further disrupt the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and control.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check while using versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to maintain card advantage. The win condition is to gradually chip away at the opponent's life total with efficient removal and burn spells, while using powerful threats like Ajani Vengeant and Celestial Colonnade to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's various colors and enable a smooth curve of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up to the card Pyromancer Ascension and then combo off by casting multiple rituals and card draw spells to generate mana and increase spell count, ultimately leading to a lethal Grapeshot. The deck capitalizes on the synergy between spells and triggers to quickly assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful storm turn. It aims to win the game in a single explosive turn by chaining spells and generating a lethal amount of storm count to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through UrzaTron lands while using removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes powerful finishers like Elesh Norn, Emrakul, and Iona to quickly close out the game once it has stabilized. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Gifts Ungiven and Thirst for Knowledge, while also having access to powerful board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of God to reset the battlefield if needed. Overall, the deck is designed to grind out wins through control and powerful threats.

The deck utilizes the land combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and mountains to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent by sacrificing lands with Scapeshift. It focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow, while also controlling the board with cards like Magma Jet and Khalni Heart Expedition. The goal is to reach the late game with Primeval Titan and overwhelm the opponent with Valakut triggers, ultimately winning the game through strategic land sacrifices and calculated attacks.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck, then win the game with Lightning Storm. The deck includes cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Bloom to accelerate mana production, while also running protection in the form of Pact of Negation. The deck also includes Sleight of Hand and Peer Through Depths to dig for combo pieces. The goal is to efficiently execute the combo and win the game in a single turn before the opponent can disrupt the strategy.

The main strategy of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo with either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite token creatures with haste. The deck has a lot of card draw, counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique for additional value and disruption. The key concept of the deck is to efficiently and quickly assemble the combo while controlling the game with disruption spells until it can be executed.

This deck aims to quickly build up infect counters on the opponent with the use of pump spells and creatures like Glistener Elf and Ichorclaw Myr. The key strategy involves using protection spells like Apostle's Blessing and Vines of Vastwood to ensure the infect creatures can deal damage safely, while also utilizing land search cards like Sylvan Scrying to find Inkmoth Nexus for additional threats. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient infect damage to secure a win before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on playing efficient and powerful creatures like Dark Confidant, Tarmogoyf, and Courser of Kruphix while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. It also utilizes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to clear the way for its creatures to attack. The deck can also control the board with cards like Anger of the Gods and Liliana of the Veil, while generating card advantage with Dark Confidant and Chandra, Pyromaster. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures and utilizing Aether Vial to cheat them into play. By flooding the board with lords such as Lord of Atlantis and Master of Waves, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent offensive strategy. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Vapor Snag and Spell Pierce helps to control the opponent's plays, while cards like Spreading Seas can disrupt their mana base. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a relentless assault of Merfolk creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly amassing a board of powerful Merfolk creatures, utilizing cards like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey to enhance their abilities. Cards like Aether Vial and Seachrome Coast help to accelerate the deployment of creatures, while Detention Sphere and Path to Exile provide removal options for enemy threats. The inclusion of Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves offer additional value and resilience to the deck. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of aggressive Merfolk creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo by creating infinite creature tokens with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite and the enchantment Splinter Twin or Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker. The deck includes various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Gitaxian Probe and Vendilion Clique provide information about the opponent's hand and help maintain card advantage. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently by going off with the combo before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.
